Photons

photon.Rd

Various functionality to deal with the 4-momentum of a photon

Usage

is.consistent.nullvec(N,TOL=1e-10)
as.photon(x,E=1)

Arguments

N

Four-momentum to be tested for nullness

TOL

tolerance

x

Vector of three-velocities

E

Energy, a scalar

Details

Returns the four-momentum of a photon.

Author

Robin K. S. Hankin

See also

4mom,reflect

Examples


## A bunch of photons all approximately parallel to the x-axis:
as.photon(as.3vel(cbind(0.9,runif(10)/1000,runif(10)/1000)))
#>       E       p_x          p_y          p_z
#>  [1,] 1 0.9999997 7.722318e-05 0.0007787134
#>  [2,] 1 0.9999995 6.286605e-04 0.0007887760
#>  [3,] 1 0.9999996 2.852761e-05 0.0008955708
#>  [4,] 1 0.9999995 9.815842e-05 0.0010176166
#>  [5,] 1 0.9999994 1.073170e-03 0.0001225190
#>  [6,] 1 0.9999995 8.186026e-04 0.0005814064
#>  [7,] 1 0.9999995 9.029002e-04 0.0003963028
#>  [8,] 1 0.9999994 1.075640e-03 0.0003245538
#>  [9,] 1 0.9999993 1.001784e-03 0.0006876100
#> [10,] 1 0.9999994 9.888803e-04 0.0005238015


## mirror ball:
jj <- matrix(rnorm(30),10,3)
disco <- sweep(matrix(rnorm(30),10,3),1,sqrt(rowSums(jj^2)),`/`)
p <- as.photon(c(1,0,0))
reflect(p,disco)
#>   E         p_x         p_y          p_z
#> x 1  0.87450752  0.31307066  0.370436708
#> x 1 -0.78763007  0.04641410  0.614397751
#> x 1 -0.88009683 -0.18513778  0.437211137
#> x 1  0.99999627 -0.00219422  0.001627815
#> x 1 -0.80783776  0.57796235 -0.115575413
#> x 1  0.68513045  0.68958520 -0.234666821
#> x 1  0.71645247 -0.35337905 -0.601514011
#> x 1 -0.09884567 -0.95281387 -0.287010898
#> x 1  0.81712914  0.38221733  0.431520436
#> x 1  0.75966592  0.62608641 -0.175850762

table(reflect(p,disco)[,2]>0) # should be TRUE with probability sqrt(0.5)
#> 
#> FALSE  TRUE 
#>     4     6 

## relativistic  disco; mirror ball moves at 0.5c:

B <- boost(as.3vel(c(0.5,0,0)))
p |> tcrossprod(B) |> reflect(disco) |> tcrossprod(solve(B))
#>           t          x            y             z
#> x 0.9581692  0.9163383  0.180751428  0.2138717332
